TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit XmlSchemaAnnotation extends System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaObject

Docs.summary: Represents the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) element.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An `annotation` element can contain one or more <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaAppInfo> instances (information for applications) and <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaDocumentation> instances (comments or text for humans).
An annotation is used to store extra information about the schema or its elements. These notes are specified for human consumption, `xs:documentation`, or by software, `xs:appinfo`. Annotation can be the first element of most schema elements or anywhere under the schema element.
## Examples The following example creates the `annotation` element.
[!code-cs[Classic WebData XmlSchemaAnnotation Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.xml.schema.xmls_26_1.cs)] [!code-vb[Classic WebData XmlSchemaAnnotation Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.xml.schema.xmls_26_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[Classic WebData XmlSchemaAnnotation Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.xml.schema.xmls_26_1.cpp)]
The following XML file is generated for the preceding code example.
